page.title: 18Ingleton School
page.content: Ingleton Church of England Controlled School, is for Infants and Juniors. The old school dated back from{1816}and was on the north side of the village. It was replaced by a new school on the south side of the village in{1967}.The new school has 3 classrooms and a hall facing south with fine views over to the{Richmond {Hills}. The{sundial}, dated 1816, and the{school bell}were brought from the old school building. Today we have{53}children on the school roll, they travel from the outlying villages by school bus.Most children stay at school for dinner which is cooked on the premises by Mrs.Priestly and Mrs.Thornton. { }On Wednesday afternoon the children go to the Swimming Baths at{Bishop {Auckland}. { }
